snippet: The financially troubled city north of Detroit is no longer under the control of an emergency manager, but that does not mean elected officials are in charge.
abstract: City of Pontiac, Mich, offers glimpse into the myriad complications that will affect Detroit as it attempts to emerge from bankruptcy proceedings and state control in 2014; though no longer under control of an emergency manager, Pontiac's mayor and City Council are still effectively without power, and private contractors continue to deliver nearly all of city's services.
lead_paragraph: The financially troubled city north of Detroit is no longer under the control of an emergency manager, but that does not mean elected officials are in charge.

headline.main: Pontiac’s Rough Road to Recovery Could Foreshadow Detroit’s Path
headline.print_headline: Pontiac’s Rough Road to Recovery Could Foreshadow Detroit’s Path
